What is this? How did you manage to mess up a game's UI THIS bad? Accidentally tapping too far to the edge exits the game. It clipped off the sides of the screen, even. Now both titles in this series are horrible. Congratulations, Paradox! You succeeded in killing your own creation. Hope youre happy in those piles of ill-deserved riches.
Old but still solid
A little redundant but still entertaining

The fact that there's no option to get your previous saves because the paradox registration is dead is the very reason why a lot of returning players of this game hate it now. Paradox has literally killed this game by inadvertently killing off the option to cloud save your progress.
I'm gonna give up, I really do love the game but the most recent update (2 years ago) made it unplayable. Do not buy the game, it is broken and will never get fix, I think.
One of the best games I've played I have it on my xbox switch and phone I really enjoy all the content I wish they made a 3rd one

Game not working on oneplus 7t

The only things I would change is; Number of items you can hold Number of items you can sell at one time More weapon choices Take off weapons an armor from the holdable items And be able to zoom out on the map

This game is great! I played Knights of Pen and Paper 2 so the mechanics were in that one as well, but I just like this one better. The gameplay is your typical turn based combat and open world discovery, but the selectable difficulty in combat is great! It helps when you only have a few party members. The character creation is great! There are stereotypical chracters from pop-culture you can choose from, but they come with passive abilities that mix well with other classes. 5/5!

The game did not fill my phone screen so I could see my home page while the game was playing and accidentally open a different app. Also registration was broken and did not allow me to create an account. Asked for a refund ASAP.
The game is really nice, but it made me lost my campaign because the sign up system doesn't work and somehow it deleted my save.
I just bought a 10,000 gold pack, but it stole my money and I don't have my gold. I cant even play it now, damn shame.

Bought this several years back, saw recently that they made a second one and decided to reinstall the first. I don't remember my login so was just going register a new account, but once I enter in the info and click register, it doesn't do anything, just sits there. So, I downloaded it on my tablet and when I open it, it freezes everything. I remember loving the game and the second one is fun too, but I'm just really bummed I can't go back and play this one again.
Simple and addictive without the need for microtransactions. What more could you want?
Unsatisfactory it feels unfinished and under developed don't waste your money and time for and incomplete experience great for off and on play but not worth it

Why can't there be more games on the app store like this one? Believe me, I've hunted for D&D-type experience games. THEY ARE AWFUL. This one always felt right though. The 2nd had flaws, but the original is something great. 4.5 rating
Couldn't get past the registration screen, hard pass.

I made a review for Knights of Pen ans Paper 2 before but i wanted to make one for this game. This is the superior version, just a solid turn based RPG that doesnt feel like its trying to nickel and dime you. The combat is simplistic as is the game itself, but unlike the second one, THIS one is actually fun. Save time on the second knights of pen and paper and just play this one instead
Coming back to the game it was destroyed and all the content I had unlocked was put behind a pay wall I played full price around launch btw devs

Absolutely brilliant game!!! Classic DnD feel with hilarious/witty cracks that make you chuckle. This game and audio backing embodies the RPG feel in ways that just defy explaination. Therefore, you have your instructions Grand Wizard, play it!
Loved this game but have been updated in years and no longer fits my phone screen.
Very entertaining. Choiceof multiple class and character combinations allows for unique runs.
gr8

Wonderfully fun game that do to paradox no longer caring about is no longer playable thanks to the game being incompatible with newer phones, I use to play this game all the time and from time to time I'd like to replay it, but thanks to a lack of updates I can no longer play it.
Register button on main screen is unresponsive.

I requested a refund but i didnt recieve my money need help

Love the retro feel. Leveling up new PC's to reasonable power levels with existing PC's is easy. Would like the game expanded more. Bought the one expansion and it was not as long as I would have hoped. Now all I can do is level up to go dragon hunting but that does get boring. More expansions till reaching lv 30 would be cool to keep the interest going. Overall still very fun and I enjoy it.
FANTASYTASTIC!

A real gem on mobile! It's very much meta gaming, but proves that meta gaming can be fun. I love that you play interesting 'real-life' characters who are playing the fantasy RPG. It's turn based, which is hard to find on mobile for some reason. I love being able to take my time! The best thing about it is that you get to choose what to do. You aren't forced to do things in a specific order (though you may sometimes find that you've wandered into maps that you aren't ready for yet.
Love this game ... Would love if this got an update to fill the screen on the s20 +
Great!
It's a great game! Turn based RPG, replaying it gets a little stale, but overall it's totally enjoyable.

Used to play this game and loved it. Re-downloaded to find that you need an account to save your progress. Not a huge deal (STILL ANNOYING AF), but the deal breaker was when nothing happened when I tried to register a new account. Kept hitting the "register" button which depressed, but nothing else would happen. Shut down the app and restarted, same issue. The game's good, but not good enough to put up with poorly implemented afterthought features.
It's dope, yo!

Paid game with in app purchases. Obviously ANY game, be it PC, console or mobile, with in-app purchases are design so that the pacing of the game is blatantly slowed down. It is just so obvious in this day and age. This game is no exception. Disappointed in Paradox because even Dungeonland on PC with in-app purchase is not as grindy as this. Shame.
Not supporting my Android 9
Absolutely AWFUL. Not balanced at ALL. Main story missions that jump 3 levels out of nowhere and leave you grinding for almost 2 hours after only a half hour of playtime

Don't waste your money. This game isn't fun nor does it respect your time. Gear upgrade has a 60% chance to fail and you don't get any gold back, gold that is a pain to gather in the first place. You can upgrade the blacksmith with grindstone which are expensive, or you can farm them by traveling between two spots, constantly, for hours on end. Each new crafting level increases success chance by 5% but the number of grindstones needed just increases exponentially. Game doesn't always save eit
Neat

I love this game to bits. Been playing it off and on since I bought it. I am having trouble since the latest update though, because I can't access the game or get my saves from the cloud. It never loads the game, kepps stuck at the loading screen.

Pretty good effort at emulating old-school dice RPG's. Seems to have slight balancing issues with enemy levels (@lvl 10+) & skills/mp consumption (you'll see what I mean, use that to yer advantage) ..if you liked table top gaming you'll probably enjoy this. The game costs about as much as a McCrud burger so buy it & support these folks & hopefully they'll stop with all the account signup nonsense & analytics and just focus on game content..

It's your typical old school rpg game. Nothing special about it. The story is unique, the dialogue is fun, but the problem with old school rpg's is how easy and simple they are. So long as you continue to grind to level you will find no difficulty in beating the game. If this game could offer some actual strategy it would actually be fun. Otherwise it's kinda stale to play.

The Good: Environment, feel, and look are all great. The game has all of the basic components of a JRPG down.  The Bad: It doesn't really do more than give you the basics. Where this game really loses points is that the developers implemented microtransactions for basic in-game currency.  You can play the game just fine without it, but the coercive nature of implementing it is downright shameful.

((Because it is currently unplayable after the first play without reinstalling, thus losing all saves, i'll have to give it a 1. I don't know if it'll ever be fixed for a more offline friendly version, but it's typically unplayable for my tablet, and i can only assume it may be the same for other tablets)) I was a fan of this game since i've played it on Steam, the gameplay and all is that of a roleplaying game mixed with Dungeons and Dragons elements, and it was quite nice and calm when you have nothing to do.  However, seems their login requirements break, especially when i had expected this to be an offline game. Playing as a guest seems to cause a permanent hourglass issue that requires a complete wipe of the whole game, making it impossible to play on a tablet, and logging in or registering doesn't work either.  I'm not sure of a workaround for this and it's making me regret purchasing the game. Theres no way to get around the hourglass unless i uninstall and reinstall the game, thus removing all of my save files in the process, and since the login screen itself doesn't work, it makes me with i could just remove that whole process entirely and play it strictly offline.

I can't think on other way to describe this game: It's just a tribute to a 
rpg player gamming life. Knights of Pen and Paper uses the history of the 
rpg as a guide to develop stages, enemies, dialogs, items, and much more! 
It's very hard to play without noticing the vast number of references, some 
are just impossible to ignore. The game has all of this and still manages 
to make the journey intriguing and full of humor! The gameplay is fluid, 
the replay level is outstanding.

Hey this version didn't delete all my progress, shove microtransactions

stuff!

money on in-app purchases too so I'm pretty upset about that.

replyContent: The save game is locally stored unfortunately. If it's removed from your device there is not so much we can do to retrieve it I'm afraid. We have learned about the virtues of cloud saves for the future at least. It's not much comfort when you already lost the save however. I'm very sorry about that and wish I could help.

I was really surprised how good this game is.  It does a lot of smart things like auto-target single creatures and allowing a tap to auto-attack instead of forcing me to select an ability.  It runs smooth on a Nexus 7 and the music/noise is pleasant without being distracting.  It plays top-to-bottom which I enjoy although it will not become bottom-to-top if your device is flipped which saddened me.  It also has the ole "freemium" aspect to it with gold coins being purchasable currency but the game is generous with what it gives you and you can earn everything by simply playing the game instead of being forced to purchase more gold (like Team Fortress 2 if you know that system).  Well worth the price and I'm looking forward to future updates.

Great game, worth every dime.

replyContent: Hey Joe. Thanks for the feedback, we've brought this up with the team to improve. Very sorry that it felt intrusive!

content: Wonderful game, play wherever when ever

I love this game. Personally I wanted to make a game just like this 3 years ago on mobile except multiplayer. Anyway, I already bought the dlc. Do I HAVE to pay for it again? I don't mind to but I did already pay for it... I have a new phone so...

The game is fantastic and fun. I recently reinstalled the game and had trouble retrieving my dlc. I contacted support and they did a refund on my old purchase and now I have my dlc again! Thanks paradox, for the great game and the helpful support!

Very fun and easy to get in to JRPG style game.  Enjoyed main story quite a bit. Controls are simple and well suited for mobile, except maybe for the inventory management, which for most of the part was a pain in the ass.  The DLC was a different story though. Felt like I've thrown money away as it did not add anything worth wile. The story was shallow more then funny. The added items were nothing special too. After 1/3 of the DLC quest I was already bored and lost all interest to play. Great disappoint. Would definitely recommend this to any JRPG fan. Just don't pick up the DLC unless you have some sort of OCPD, as almost for the same price you can get P&P 2.
Great rpg
Love the look of the game and is fun if you are looking for a good rpg
Woo
Just crashes repeatedly on launch on an HTC M8. Disappointed because it looked like a fun game...
Auto-rotation is always on, which is extremely annoying when I want to play while lying down inmy bed. Otherwise, good game
Fun game lots of good content only thing lacking is multiplayer options.
Over time it gets very grindy,kinda boring, too expensive for the amount of time I played it for
Thanks for quick and good response whenever we have problem in playing this game

Was I scammed from buyinng a full versioned one?

At first, I downloaded this game and keep on crashing. After disabling internet connection, this game works perfectly and love playing this game. Definitely going to buy the +2 version after completing this game!

it's an awesome game and very fun to play,  too bad I haven't been able to play it because it keeps crashing

Fun game, but constantly loses my progress. After losing a few hours I give up.

Is what I was looking for in the app store for a month, we'll worth it and very entertaining, no silly additional in app purchases to make the game winnable, just there for people that don't like to grind old rpg school style

I CAN'T PUT IT DOWN! This game is beyond words; I've been looking for a great RPG for android since forever, and here it is! A little tip - I think your phone should have lots of working memory, since it takes quite a lot to power the game. Aside from that, get ready for one of the most addicting adventure games you've ever played! Developers, if you're reading, how about a promo code for some gold LOL.
Every time I log in with Google shortly after Google Play Services stops working.

I enjoy playing this game more than most of my pc games, and that includes a fallout and elder scrolls title! If you've ever pen and papered in real life it captures the mood of a typical group to a tee, very funny at times and always with the endless monsters for no good reason than dice rolling, lol. I'm absolutely won over with this app, best game I've played since Skyrim.

This game is super awesome! I have Never played anything like this before! Gg I hope you make more than 2 of these! ;)

Very entertaining and replayable!

fun game played it through quite a few times now

This game is fantastic! The only problem is that I've beaten the game a couple times with different combinations of characters. I wish that the game could expand gameplay a bit with new locations and characters, but for free, this is an expensive app! But overall, amazing game

I really love this little game, I like being able to battle various monsters to level up and also acquire gold through effort. The ability to buy gold is great because the blacksmith is based on chance and it can be a real gold sink. Quests are fun so far and have decent dialogue. However cloud saving should be useable with one's Google Account not with an additional account requirement. A must have feature.
Purchased and always crashes after title screen. Waited to rate until a few updates still does not work.

With latest update, expansion pack works to purchase to play past the Tear. Really enjoy this. Good turned based role play, difficulty requires grinding which I don't mind. Pixel graphics, chiptune music and sound effects, classic nerd references, and winning hard battle all very satisfying. Non-linear adventure and lots to do. Great dialogue. Fun for a few minutes or an hour.
Hopefully this will be fixed in the future!

One of the best mobile games you can get

content: I love it

Save for the big and fixable flaw the game is great, with funny dialogue, a high degree of customizability and overall a classic feel. The big issue is that any in-app purchases, whether for the DLC or to buy gold are broken. I've been staring at the hourglass try and load the purchases page for a good while now and nothing has happened. Honestly, with IAP being used here to save you from grinding for gold for hours, it's funny how grinding is now the faster strategy to get gold. Beats staring at an hourglass while writing a review.
Great game
Super awesome game finished it like couple of times, using different teams and ++ mode. Funny, interesting plot and great time filler while taking a dump :)

I bought this game on iOS almost two years ago, and, after beating the 2cd game, I thought I'd buy the 1st one again and relive some memories! Now, don't get me wrong, this is a great game, but in some ways it's better than the 2cd and in some ways worse. Better ways are: More characters and classes, DLC (which shows up on my device...), and tons more to do quest wise. Worse ways are: graphics, short MAIN campaign (beat it in less time than the 2cd), and battles are easier. This is a great game though! :)

Would also like the ability to delete game saves, and to back out a new game start without having to shut down the app. Finally, an in-game "Player's Guide" that offers brief descriptions of items, locations, and other things encountered or unlocked would be a fun addition.

Pro:  the idea behind it is pretty awesome, the skills are amazing for each class, very well balanced for the gamer, enemies arent just stronger copy and pasted, customizing the outside world for more gold or exp is neat, the dice rolls for luck is cool.                                       .                                                                   Con: once youve beat the game, doing world+ kinda sucks because your weapons amd armour dont get better, to unlock some of the classes takes to long.

It not always about great graphics,  game is very well thought up; I got the expansion DLC as well. I would love to see more classes or spells in the future. I would give 7 stars. Excellent work, by the development team. Keep it up.

The auto rotate function is insanely over sensitive (tilt hand slightly, everything is now sideways and tiny) and there's no option to disable it in game, so I have to download and run a separate app too play without annoying interruption - also lack of cloud save is extremelly limitting.

End end game I feel pressured into a certain set up that makes me feel like magic characters as anything but support to your attack seems iffy.  And I mean late game like 100+ amazing game though spent many hours on it.
Great game

As of my current condition, i had no means of entertainment, So I decided to buy this game since I had the biggest urge to play something DnD like. I was not dissapointed.    I'm running against the issue where the app will still rotate the screen even if my phone has 'auto-rotate' off.  Also, the addition of a in-game encyclopedia that gets filled as you go would be a really nice touch
OMG i love it so much and also Dlc

I factory reset my phone because it was being incredibly laggy, and lost all my progress in pen and paper. I backed up all my data, I just assumed my progress would save too. I'm not bothered to restart it, but it was fun while it lasted. Very enjoyable game, well worth the money.

A game true to the spirit of D&D and table top games in general. So much fun and great humour!

Hi Corey, 

thanks for your feedback! Sorry for shocking you with the pricepoint; it's not actually the right one: The Haunted Fall DLC is $1.99 on iOS and Android.

Cheers!

content: Can't tell you how good this game is you have to play it. I didn't give it five stars because there is no cloud save even tho google play supports it.

Great rpg, nice pixel art, and story set up, slick touch interface.

Very pleasant game to play awesome idea and it shows:)!

content: The game was fun and the dlc with it was also fun. Upon downloading this game it is by far the best purchase I have made to date on Google Playstore.  Made with a hilarious plot and classic rpg traits.  It blends the nerdy and geeky themes perfectly.  You have a true masterpiece in this game with a rare potential for hours of nonstop play.

content: Perfection

Play as a group of characters as they play an RPG. This game has a perfect blend of humour in the writing, along with a good mix of classic RPG mechanics and some new additions that work well. The game has in-app purchases but these were completely optional and not forced at all, I finished the entire game without making any IAP. I ended up buying some in game currency afterwards just to reward the developers for doing such an excellent job on the game. I look forward to their next game "Chroma Squad"

This is a brilliant RPG, it's easy to pick up and play a few minutes or to spend hours on it. If you're expecting a great looking (graphics) game then obviously this might not be the game for you. However if you love the classic RPG's of SNES or GBC then you will love this. It feels nostalgic and original at the same time. And frankly for the price you will struggle to get more value for your money from any other game or any other median of entertainment frankly. One warning though it does require a fair bit of reading text conversations if you wish to follow the plot/quest lines however that's standard in many RPG's even WoW.

replyContent:
Hi Leandro!

Very sorry to hear about this; we weren't aware of any such issue. If you could spare the time and set up a report (including your device and Android OS version), we may be able to get this resolved by the next version. We gather tech issues at this location:

https://paradox.zendesk.com/

Thanks!

I think if they modeled a little more after Tiny Tower it'd be the most perfect game and I'd never put it down.

I find this game very entertaining. If you like RPG games this may be a game for you. If you are a serious RPG player though this game may not be the game for you. I have a minor issue with it but it's still a good game. My issue is the fact that I would rather this game have been a slight more serious. The humor for me was just kid type humor. Sometimes it's funny but some times it's like a kid calling you a peanut butter and jelly sandwhich. Funny because it's so stupid. Though I must say the humor does fit the graphics. I would really love to see this style of game with a more serious twist to it. Oh and if you don't like being made fun of as an RPGer you might wanna stay away. I, however, find these jokes the funniest in this game bc I am a serious RPGer and they got a lot of the stereotypes right :). All that being said I have to stress this game did waaaaay more right then wrong. Overall it has been a very entertaining and fun experience. Devs if you haven't already considered making a game exactly like this but a serious RPG experience I think it would be a good suggestion to consider.

Unlike every other game I played on my phone this one didn't disappoint me. First off it isn't going to try to rip you off, making you spend additional money. Doing so is 100% unnecessary. The game's D@D RPG elements work well with your parties customization. Each class offers something unique to mix up the fundamental tank/dps/healer game-play. Some items are unlocked permanently adding to the games replayability along with the additional classes as you progress. Your Characters gear wont feel shallow as it is designed to make diversity in play-styles. From these mechanics comes debatable options of how you will want to use synergy between your classes and their skills. With the no need for additional purchases, solid mechanics, and unique ironic charm, Knights of Pen & Paper +1 is the only game I have experienced on this marketplace that I feel deserves 5 stars and especially for its cheap price.

First off a little bit about my hatred for most mobile games. I am a PC Gamer (The master race). The reason I've hated every mobile game I've installed is I felt they were made for "simpler" people. They are usually short, lack depth, boring, and riddled with bugs. That being said, this game has none of those faults. This is the first mobile game I've played that I have literally drained my entire battery playing, from 100% to "Crap, where is my charger!?."   It reminds me a lot of  FF1-2/Chronotrigger. There isn't as much story of course, and there doesn't need to be. You are literally playing a game within a game. If you've ever played D&D or Pathfinder, then you'll thoroughly enjoy the banter from the GM and the players with comments like "Where is my loaded dice?" First game and first App I've ever given 5 stars to. Great job Dev team, my only suggestion to you guys would be in a later version maybe implement a multiplayer game option so I could play with my wife while we're waiting in line somewhere.   My only suggestion to players is back up your game somehow! I have a rooted T-Mobile S3 so I just use Titanium Backup, but I'm sure there is some kind of non-rooted option.

This is a truly wonderful game that elegantly captures the spirit and elements of traditional RPGs and presents it in a succinct and witty manner; fine-tuned for the mobile/tablet platform. Knights of Pen & Paper delivers that child-like sense of adventure with wholesome but sharp humour and an amiable ensemble of characters. It has nursed a long forgotten piece of my heart from my innocent days, back to its tender vitality.

A silly premise, but turns out to be quite fun and addictive.  The "meta" level just adds slight variety to character creation and power-ups, but it never gets in the way of game play. (You don't have to actually manage their lives.)   The game itself feels like an old school full-party CRPG, with a quest path to follow but room to explore if you want to sandbox. The DM mechanic means it never feels like a grind.  Only flaw is lack of new skills as chars level up‚Äîit would be fun to have more to choose from

Easy to play, easy to figure out, fun and absorbing.   This game is a lot of fun for a small investment.  Simply, you are controlling a dungeon crawling party - fighters, wizards, clerics, etc.  Fight monsters, save villages, collect gold.   There isn't a way to veer from the story line, but for what the game is, that's fine.   You can upgrade armor, buy healing potions, etc.  Graphic wise, the way the DM and players - all sitting around a table - are merged into the visuals of the story is amusing, and I found to be fun.  Gold, obviously, controls what you can buy in the game.  There is a way to purchase gold, but I've not yet seen where this is necessary.

Retro pixelated graphics are charming and have a nice unified aesthetic. Looks great on my Nexus 4 and Nexus 10.   Gameplay is old school turn based combat with wizards, knights, fantasy characters.   Music can get a little dull, but initially doesn't detract from the entertainment value.   I'm giving this game a 5 star rating because for the cost of the app, the value is really there for me. RPG's may be niche, but this game fills the void quiet well.   I have one minor complaint though. In order to obtain better equipment in this game, you must collect coins and take those coins to the blacksmith. The coins are earned little by little and the equipment is very expensive in comparison to what you earn. On top of this, the blacksmith only has a chance of 40% to successfully create your desired equipment. Many, many times this will fail, and the blacksmith will essentially steal your hard earned cash, while you're prompted to try again. Try again and don't have the coin? You're prompted to purchase an In-App bundle of coins.   I've leveled the blacksmith up and my success rate is now 55%, but it failed 10 times in a row, feels like thievery. Please fix this.

This game is a completely meta, turn-based adventure game that takes classic RPG battle systems and melds it with an authentic' and almost nostalgic, D&D experience. Your campaign is long and wrought with danger as your party constantly changes, with players at the table coming and going. Even the table jargon is spot on . I could go on and on, but to sum it up; spare yourself that McDonalds combo at lunch today and do yourself a favor by buying this game!
I was very sceptical at first when playing on a friend's phone, but 30 minutes later I was happily grinding on King Slimes. It's the absolute best turn based game I've seen on Android.

I really like this game from its classic pixelation UI to its game play. The biggest problem I have with this game is the business model that limits it. It has fallen victim to greed just like many other mobile games that are made to be grinding unless the user pays in game purchases. There is also no way to turn off the automatic game save. So if you die without money....you have to pay to get more gold in the game to resurrect your characters. Why won't developers learn that they can charge more money for a purchase of a game instead of limiting and crippling a game? Its okay, customers will pay more for a complete unrestricted game. I guess there are a lot of stupid people out there that don't see how much they actually pay in the long run and companies like this are built to milk the customer. The same stupid people who complain about a complete mobile game charged at $10 or $15. Build a game for the love of the game and not for greed / suffocating the customer.

That's some great customer support there.  Thanks again guys and keep up the great work!  LOVE this game!

Knights of Pen & Paper is the most fun I have had with a game on the Android OS. I played it on my Nexus 7 Tablet and, in that first day, lost a number of hours to it. I am not generally a fan of touch-screen gaming, but this game uses the screen to its benefit by focusing on simple taps to interact with the UI as opposed to a silly virtual d-pad or other nonsense. This is important as it allows the user to intuitively interact with every part of the UI quickly, making the game one that is easy to jump into for short bursts when necessary. This is aided by the way quests are handled by the game, having you take the role of a dungeon master in charge of a party of table top RPG players. You can customize your real world accessories (your table, room, snacks, etc) then go into the fantasy world, which has lovely sprite work featuring homages to obvious inspirations (D&D) and even games like Journey. You take quests from various townsfolk who request that you kill monsters in dungeons, find items, escort people to far away lands, and more. All of this is done while leveling and customizing your party through their skills and gear.   This is a perfect example of touch-screen gaming.

This is, in my estimation, the perfect mobile RPG. The game is a fantastic parody of the old school RPGs of my youth (phantasy star, final fantasy, etc.) and captures the best features of those games. This is one of the few times I can say the I want a sequel to a mobile game. Also, I would like to commend the developers on the use of portrait mode. I have a 30 minute bus ride every day and playing games in landscape mode can be a bit of an issue.

Let us have character storage! As in, i dont want to have to delete my barbarian lvl 17 to make way for a lvl 1 hunter and if i decided to change it back to barbarian its back to lvl1. Sucks for that  Or at least allow new characters to start at a median level

Thanks to the developers for fixing the game breaking bug. I can now give a proper review. This is probably the greatest rpg on android. It has a great retro feel but with fresh ideas. Being able to choose your own battles makes for some great tactical gameplay. The controls are intuitive and responsive (though I would like to be able to scroll the item shop menu a bit faster.. still, no big deal). The story is a cute parody of retro rpgs with mostly well translated humour and several amusing pop culture references (check out the dungeon masters!). All in all, I can't recommend this game enough. Only game I've given 5 stars to!  The only thing I can say to the Devs is great job and maybe consider a lite/demo version as I think giving people a taste of the game beforehand would be a good idea.

Game is OK if not a bit amusing. What is killing it for me is the micro transactions in the game. The developer put a store in the game that takes real money and them tweaked the whole game so you can achieve everything,  but slower than at snail pace.  Example: you have to get the blacksmiths to level up buy buying some component then once he is finally doing something it is in 2 actual hours! Of course you get the 'advantage' of speeding things up for more cash. AVOID AVOID AVOID

This game is a great way to peacefully lose hours of your life xD There is an option to buy the in game currency with cash but, since the update, they've increased the rate at which money drops in game. If your a fan of the days of turn based Final Fantasy style combat this Is a great homage with a story to pull you through the game and a sandbox combat option whenever you feel the need to flex your party's muscle or XP/Loot farm. As others have said, easy to control and so much fun to play! *It's obviously influenced by JRPG's when it comes to things like the combat system and moving around the games world, but has far far less annoying random encounters and nothing in it feels like a grind. *A large number of individual great little quests & touches of RPG/gaming humour. *No quest lasting too long without somewhere to rest, and the fact that you can just do some plain combat to gain xp in any location, it's a perfect mobile game to pick up and play a little then put down (if you can). The best compliment I can give this game is that, as a huge 16-bit RPG fan and an Android developer, this is almost exactly the game I always hoped to make myself. I've finished it once and am playing again with the advanced classes (replay value, hooray!).  The game is fairly deep without being overwhelming. The interface is mostly well thought out; there are some minor pain points, e.g. traveling only one point at a time and being immediately sent to the area screen instead of staying on the map is consistently irritating, but it still handles vastly better than most mobile RPG's and is in most cases very intuitive.  Of course, it has to be intuitive; unless I missed something, there does not appear to be any kind of basic game mechanics tutorial, leaving you to figure just about everything out yourself. It has enough quirky differences to make for a few head-scratching "what's this" and "how do I do that" moments, but as part of the game experience that's OK.  I don't have a problem with charging for a game, especially when the price is so low and the quality is so high, but using IAP in addition to the up-front charge seems odd. Fortunately, it's entirely unnecessary.

I really like this game. The only fault is that it drains my battery.

The downside: While you don't NEED to buy gold, the game is very stingy in giving it out. Especially considering you have to pay gold to do almost anything in game. Even traveling costs gold. To give you an idea, I just had a battle that netted me 1500 Experience Points, and only 16 Gold. And it cost me 5 Gold to get to the place where I had that battle. And two of my characters were wearing Extra Gold Amulets.   It's a very fun game, and I've been enjoying it, but I feel like I'm never going to have enough gold to feel like I can really feel successful in the game.

I'm enjoying the heck out of this game, currently trying a split warrior / berserker tank with only a did for healing - not easy, but fun. This is a cute concept, but falls short of its potential. In my experience, true tabletop gaming centers around the creativity of its players, not the accumulation of exp and gold. This game is like the worst kind of grind (think Dragon Warrior 1) but with a couple customization options, a loose tabletop theme, and compromised balance to encourage microtransactions.

Reviews list in both English and Portuguese are overestimating this game. Their praises aren't matching the truth about it. While this game vaunts itself for being a table-turn-based RPG, it isn't different at all from all the other "RPG"s available in Google Play. It is extremely tedious, since all you gotta do is "travel" around places fetching items and killing monsters that grow slightly in difficulty, never offering a real challenge. The skills are linear growing and from the beginning to the end of the game the only thing that changes is "damage dealt" and "mana cost". Everything is just so annoyingly linear and predictable that you wouldn't bother continuing this game to the end unless you already paid for it.  It is just plain retarded. There isn't any plot and the so called "funny jokes" the reviews below so intensely praised just aren't there at all. If you're looking to kill some time in a repetitive childish money hunting game, download it.
This game is fabulous :)  We need a sequence plz?

Could Be Best Game On Market But Relies Too Heavily On In App Purchases	This is an absolutely fantastic game. Good humor, great 8-bit graphics, well thought out interface and combat, etc. They really got everything right. Except for gold. Gold is required for everything. Even travel. And you get very, very little of it in combat. The emphasis is very much on buying it with dollars via in app purchases. Even worse, with travelling you can't just go from point A to point C - you have to go step-by-step A then B then C with each leg costing more gold.

Knights of Pen & Paper is an odd game. It's interface is simplistic, with pixelated graphics. It's writing is a bit dodgy, with some weird phrasing and other grammar issues. It's battles are barely animated and since you are both the dungeon master as well as the person controlling the characters that are role playing, you basically create your own story as you play it. But the writing can also be quite clever and funny, and there appears to be quite a bit of depth to the game. Not only are there lots of classes to choose from but you can also buy tons of other stuff, from more characters in your party to great weapons and even furniture for the room you are role playing in. It's definitely an interesting concept and it has me very intrigued. I'm glad I bought it and will continue to play to see if it can sustain my interest.

I was really enjoying this game, but now I'm at a point where you need to grind gold to really progress. Or I suppose you can purchase more gold when they enable the IAP which I don't find acceptable considering you've already paid for the game.   Traveling is expensive, a collection quest I did nets me a mere 27 gold for a good 10 minutes of fighting. Consumables are too expensive to use, it's cheaper to resurrect yourself. The blacksmith is a total lottery until you upgrade him, which of course takes more gold to do. 75 gold for a chance to craft an item that takes 7 hrs real time..

Keep in mind, I love this game so far. As a tabletop player I find the humor very welcoming and funny. However I really don't want to see this app abuse paid content. Add new characters, yes. Add more levels, yes. But please don't put timers on the game, or require items to only be purchased with a unique currency.

You play as the dungeon master, where you select your environment, what you fight and how many creatures you fight, and the players, which "race" and class they are.  Worth it for Mill Burray alone.

I've been playing RPG's since their inception. Grew up on the first Ultima, broke my gums on the gold box games, learned to walk with Final Fantasy and Dragon quest.  Modern RPG's haven't changed much. This takes it all back to its roots, adds a nice twist, changes the mechanics - and feels satisfyingly nostalgic.  On top of that, the interface is utilized very well. No need to worry about on screen d-pads or other poorly thought out implementations, the UI is clearly designed with touch in mind.

Sure, there are some grammar and spelling issues and there are imperfections and rough edges but this is an incredibly deep RPG that wouldn't have been out of place back in the NES days! Love it, and looking forward to more issues being ironed out over time :)

This game is amazing. I love the way it simulates the good old days of sitting around the table with friends playing any of a number of popular fantasy pen and paper games back in the late 70s, and throughout the 80s. I was on vacation this past week, and spent almost all of Wednesday and Thursday playing the two campaigns. The first campaign is huge and extremely fun. Great story/plot, lots of side quests, locales, and of course monsters to slay and loot.      The second campaign is a bit shorter, but I liked the concept of being forced (slavery) into being a gladiator in an arena. Another cool aspect is that you unlock new and more powerful classes during a campaign. You can replace your current heroes with new ones sporting these new classes, or wait until you start a new campaign as you basically begin with new heroes as you would in the old pen and paper days when you began playing a new RPG system, or a new world/campaign.      In closing, the guys did a really great job, and promise more content. I've purchased plenty of apps for my Motorola Xoom over the years, and this is my favorite. It may end up yours too!

The game seems like it has promise, but I'm not planning on picking this up again (or recommending to friends) until all these game-breaking bugs are sorted out.

The entire role-playing experience now on your phone! I'm loving the quick, easy gameplay and the pixel art!

Love this game. Its a bit buggy, and it crashes sometimes, but the game is a blast. You can tell a lot of work went into it and I love the music and the art design. The gameplay is addictive and simple, yet great fun. I'll be playing this one for some time to come!

There are quite a few bugs, some game crashing, as well as some monotonous "Kill X rats" style quests. Despite that, this is the most original game that I've played for Android. If I were the devas, I'd work the kinks out and then double the price. Would still be worth it.
Was utterly surprised about how this game was. And I have to say... I love it! Though I think there should be a bit more variety for classes, but for now these classes work just fine!
Way to addicting for how simple it is.  Typos and minor graphical errors aside this game is amazing and worth your money.

Most fun I've had with a game in a while, but it tends to crash every five minutes or so and return to the home screen which also loses my progress from the previous battle or event. If this could be fixed it would absolutely be five stars.
A perfect rpg

It is a simple game, but one that has some surprising depth.  As the title suggests it works very much like a table top game.  Enjoyable and somewhat unique. Looks like it might have some in app purchases in the future, but it does not have any at the moment. You can't go wrong for the price.
Very well made game with a lot of minor details that add to its character. If you are fond of old school rpgs, this is easily a must buy.
Can't wait for this to be finished
But it crashes a lot.  Still 4 stars and definitely 5 once that's fixed.
A simple yet clever idea very well executed.  RPG and/or  pencil and paper D&D player's will find something to waste away the hours here.
Can't wait to play this on iOS.
Alot of fun to play, but some minor graphical glitches (text goes outside the screen, New Game/Load Game buttons almost overlap and some minor spelling and grammar issues. Great game nonetheless :-)

This is a great Role Playing game, played really as a role playing game, it has fun, adventure, battles and you get experience points for the role playing (lol). It still has a few bugs, but nothing that hold your fun.

The game is full of content and unlocks. Aside from a couple of spelling errors this is the most fun I have ever had playing a game on my phone.

I usually don't pay for apps, but this game convinced me to reconsider. I wanted to support a developer headed in a good direction.   There are a few bugs mentioned by other reviewers, but I'm confident they will address these concerns. There should be a demo/lite version for people to see if it's compatible with their device.   That aside, my only gripe with the game is the grammar. I'm willing to overlook this, and would honestly want to fix it myself if possible.
Hope they keep it updated

The shop and cauldron still crashes my phone and major graphic glitches. Paladin Leader strike's Bonus isn't add onto the attack. Overall, it was fun to play.

Just.... wow. This game is fantastic. The artwork is perfect for this style. The humor is awesomely nerdy and very similar to the conversations me and my friends have while playing D&D. This is a must by for fans of squad turn based combat games. The battles do become a little repetitive but the constant drive to make it 'just one more level' makes even this slight flaw manageable. My only request to the developers is more skills for the different classes (maybe 6 or 8) and a little bit of random chance in the combat (such as misses and more specials for enemies). As it is though, I have blown over 10 hours and I'm not even halfway through.   Buy this. Buy this now.   Also, when they say 'unlockable characters and classes' they mean that you earn them by playing. They are not extra purchases.

This is one of those games worthy of having on your Android.... IF it didn't had such crippling bugs. I've bought it in hopes this will incentivate the game studio to fix the bugs ASAP. 2 stars only until there's a decent fix.
Very creative, memorable and filled with easter eggs. Must have.
Lots of humour and customisation, very simple game mechanic and well-balanced progression. Played on a Galaxy Tab, no crash problems at all.

The game is completely original and is one of the better games I've played this year period. There are some crashing issues but even with that this is a solid game. I can only imagine what future updates will add and I'll give it 5 stars once the bugs get taken care of.
All around great game.
Really wish gems like this somehow got more attention
